committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Compensation and Employee Benefits

official_title: A bill to amend title 5, United States Code, to provide that a Federal employee who participates in the Government's health benefits program for a continuous period of 20 years or longer shall be eligible to continue enrollment as an annuitant, without regard to an interruption of less than 1 year during the 5-year period before separation.

summary.text: Provides that a Federal employee who participates in the Federal health benefits program for a continuous period of 20 years shall be eligible to continue enrollment as an annuitant without regard to a break in service of less than one year during the five-year period before retirement.

titles.title: A bill to amend title 5, United States Code, to provide that a Federal employee who participates in the Government's health benefits program for a continuous period of 20 years or longer shall be eligible to continue enrollment as an annuitant, without regard to an interruption of less than 1 year during the 5-year period before separation.
